### emitRemark() {#ad2f17271150dcc28c542e70f0aa3614c}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename RemarkKind, typename RemarkCallBack&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;OpenMPOpt.cpp&#125;::OpenMPOpt::emitRemark (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> RemarkName, RemarkCallBack &amp;&amp; RemarkCB) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
&#125;&#125;

Emit a remark generically

This template function can be used to generically emit a remark. The RemarkKind should be one of the following:
<ul>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/optimizationremark">OptimizationRemark</a> to indicate a successful optimization attempt</li>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/optimizationremarkmissed">OptimizationRemarkMissed</a> to report a failed optimization attempt</li>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/optimizationremarkanalysis">OptimizationRemarkAnalysis</a> to provide additional information about an optimization attempt</li>
</ul>


The remark is built using a callback function provided by the caller that takes a RemarkKind as input and returns a RemarkKind.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp/#l01996">1996</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp">OpenMPOpt.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  template={<>template &lt;typename RemarkKind, typename RemarkCallBack&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;OpenMPOpt.cpp&#125;::OpenMPOpt::emitRemark (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42; F, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> RemarkName, RemarkCallBack &amp;&amp; RemarkCB) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>

### getCombinedIdentFromCallUsesIn() {#a2845e06a132e2396c2e4e1f918070ab4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;OpenMPOpt.cpp&#125;::OpenMPOpt::getCombinedIdentFromCallUsesIn (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-openmpopt-cpp-/ompinformationcache/runtimefunctioninfo">OMPInformationCache::RuntimeFunctionInfo</a> &amp; RFI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F, bool GlobalOnly)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return an <code>struct ident&#95;t&#42;</code> value that represents the ones used in the calls of <code>RFI</code> inside of <code>F</code>.

If <code>GlobalOnly</code> is true, we will not return a local <code>struct ident&#95;t&#42;</code>. For now, if we cannot find a suitable return value we create one from scratch. We also do not yet combine information, e.g., the source locations, see combinedIdentStruct.

### hideMemTransfersLatency() {#a43011da7160ae47cbf3544207a5ff5dc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;OpenMPOpt.cpp&#125;::OpenMPOpt::hideMemTransfersLatency ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Tries to hide the latency of runtime calls that involve host to device memory transfers by splitting them into their &quot;issue&quot; and &quot;wait&quot; versions.

The &quot;issue&quot; is moved upwards as much as possible. The &quot;wait&quot; is moved downards as much as possible. The &quot;issue&quot; issues the memory transfer asynchronously, returning a handle. The &quot;wait&quot; waits in the returned handle for the memory transfer to finish.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp/#l01554">1554</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp">OpenMPOpt.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
